title: Packet loss with 2000 ping
body:
Almost every game iv played in the past couple weeks have been basically unplayable. Rarely i have a lag free game but most my ping goes from 80 to 1000-2000 while my champion moves around like a ghost. 
League of Legends is the ONLY game i have this problem with. My usual internet speed is about 1.5mbs and all other games can get 80 ping. 
Iv sent a diagnostics report twice, but still nothing.

replies.body: I dont understand why i can play ANY other game, watch HD videos with no lag WHAT so ever, but when it comes to league, im sitting here with 300-1000 ping while jumping all over the lane as my teammates flame at me for being bad.

Hey man, I just did a bit of research. Telecom isn't actually that great an ISP. Have you considered swapping?

Have you called them up for assistance yet?

Also, for future replies, please use the "Reply" button so that I get notification of your responses.

AH my bad. Well see the thing is (i forgot to mention) im living in work accommodation and have a shared network. Its still fast and gets to about 1.5mbs. Even then, its still fast at all times, no matter what game i play, but not with league. Im assuming its when lots of people are using the internet and cant cope with it, but still only with league.
I havnt rang telecom up, dont know if i could not being the owner.
And apologies for my out burst up there, was playing a few games and got very salty o.O, something im working on improving since playing again after a year.
thanks for your help, appreciate it.

I wouldn't call that an outburst at all, at least compared to what I've seen people regard as "a normal reaction".

*Have* you tried using another DNS yet?
I think its just having so many people connected at once. Later on in the night 10-11pm itll stop
i ahve done every kind of fuckin test, anaylsis, and yet nothing is coming up.

Telecom i think, and mavericks on a Macbook pro. 
It is pissing me off increasingly more and more being dumped right into the enemy team.

Have you looked over [this page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#section-mac)?

Mainly, try using an alternate DNS. That surprisingly fixes a lot of issues that people have, even though it shouldn't. If you have trouble with any of them, just ask.

Best of luck.

>Iv sent a diagnostics report twice, but still nothing.

The reds are *very* busy.

What ISP and OS are you on? Have you tried closing all other applications while playing League (I know it's pretty dumb to ask, but League really doesn't play nice with other applications using the internet)?
